p.q: Here is the e-mail Jorge, another student, wrote:
p.q2: Ximena wants to give Jorge constructive feedback so that he reflects on his mistakes. Which of the following pieces of advice is more appropriate for Ximena's purpose?

as.a: "The content of your writing is ok. However, there are some punctuation mistakes in it. I have included commas and periods where necessary."
"The message is clear, but you haven't used commas and periods adequately. Remember commas help you separate clauses and periods introduce new ideas."
"The purpose of inviting someone was achieved. On the other hand, what do you think about the punctuation? How can you improve the flow of your message?"
